definition: to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: Journalists are studying the minister's speech for pointers to the contents of next month's policy statement.
sentences.chinese: 记者们在研究部长讲话以揣摩下月施政报告中的动向。

sentences.english: It thus seems that people are rather positive about this year's address.
sentences.chinese: 由此看来，巿民似乎对施政报告有不错的评价。

sentences.english: Members from the drafting group introduce the mock policy address during a press conference.
sentences.chinese: 起草小组成员于新闻发布会上介绍模拟施政报告。

sentences.english: Mr Tung will disclose more details in his policy address.
sentences.chinese: 董建华将在施政报告中透露更多详情。

sentences.english: People from all walks of life, including government officials highly appreciate the mock policy address.
sentences.chinese: 模拟施政报告得到社会各界及政府部门的高度肯定。

definition: Leung Chun-ying (1954-), 3rd Chief Executive of Hong Kong
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
abbr. for 民主建港協進聯盟|民主建港协进联盟, Democratic alliance for the betterment of Hong Kong (DAB), Hong Kong pro-Beijing party
chief executive of Special Administrative Region (Hong Kong or Macao)/abbr. for 特別行政區首席執行官|特别行政区首席执行官
Hong Kong Stock Exchange/abbr. for 香港交易所
Sir Donald Tsang or Tsang Yam-Kuen (1944-)
Anson Chan (1940-), chief secretary for administration, Hong Kong (1997-2001)
